biography.value:
Found in the waters of the Abyss and other bodies of water contaminated by that plane’s fell influence, wastriliths establish themselves as lords of the deep and rule their dominions with cruelty.

A wastrilith pollutes the waters around it. Its noxious presence even affects nearby sources of water when the demon travels on land. The corrupted water, which contains a measure of the demon’s essence, responds to the wastrilith’s commands—perhaps hardening to prevent foes from escaping or erupting in a surge that drags victims into its reach.

Creatures that ingest water corrupted by a wastrilith risk their very souls. Those who drink the poisonous liquid might wither away until they finally die, or they remain alive only to become thralls of chaos and evil. To represent this defilement, you can use the optional rule on abyssal corruption in chapter 2 of the Dungeon Master’s Guide, causing the poisoned creature to be corrupted.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse
Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The wastrilith makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks, and it uses Grasping Spout.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 4d12 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

description.value:
The wastrilith magically launches a spout of water at one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a [[/save str 17 format=long]], and it has disadvantage if it’s underwater. On a failed save, it takes [[/damage 4d8 + 4 type=acid average=true]] damage and is pulled up to 60 feet toward the wastrilith. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn’t pulled.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Amphibious. The wastrilith can breathe air and water.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Corrupt Water. At the start of each of the wastrilith’s turns, exposed water within 30 feet of it is befouled. Underwater, this effect lightly obscured;lightly obscures the area until a current clears it away. Water in containers remains corrupted until it evaporates.

A creature that consumes this foul water or swims in it must make a [[/save con 18 format=long]]. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the foul water for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature takes 14 (4d6) &Reference[poison]{poison} damage and is &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned} for 1 minute. At the end of this time, the &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned} creature must repeat the saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 18 (4d8) &Reference[poison]{poison} damage and is &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned} until it finishes a long rest.

If another demon drinks the foul water as an action, it gains 11 (2d10) temporary hit points.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Magic Resistance. The wastrilith has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
If the wastrilith is underwater, it causes all water within 60 feet of it to be difficult terrain for other creatures until the start of its next turn.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse
